prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]

prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]

raw.proposer:
{
  "selected_names": ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5"],
  "params_overrides": {},
  "score_preset": "robust_smape",
  "force_debate": true,
  "debate_margin": 0.05,
  "rationale": "High model disagreement (relative spread mean 2.49) and horizon-specific winners justify combining a robust baseline, horizon-specific selection, and regularized stacking to balance stability and adaptability."
}
raw.statistician: {"add_names": ["inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5"], "remove_names": [], "params_overrides": {"ridge_stacking_l250_topk3": {"shrinkage": 0.30}, "trimmed_mean_r0.20": {"trim_ratio": 0.10}}, "rationale": "Added inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25 (stable performance) and topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 (robust horizon aggregation). Adjusted ridge_stacking_l250_topk3 shrinkage to 0.30 for better stability and trimmed_mean_r0.20 trim_ratio to 0.10 for reduced outlier sensitivity.", "changes": [{"name": "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "field": "shrinkage", "from": "default", "to": 0.30, "reason": "Improved stability with moderate shrinkage"}, {"name": "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "field": "trim_ratio", "from": 0.20, "to": 0.10, "reason": "Reduced outlier impact while maintaining robustness"}], "when_good": "When n_windows is small and stability is prioritized over aggressive trimming"}

proposer.rationale: High model disagreement (relative spread mean 2.49) and horizon-specific winners justify combining a robust baseline, horizon-specific selection, and regularized stacking to balance stability and adaptability.

skeptic.rationale: Baseline_mean is unstable (RMSE_std 266.54). Trimmed_mean_r0.20 (RMSE 1044.97) and ridge_stacking_l250_topk3 (MAPE 2.586) offer better stability. Best_per_horizon_by_validation has higher MAPE (3.35) and lower score (1.11). Recommended knobs: trim_ratio=0.2, shrinkage=0.35, l2=50 for better regularization.
skeptic.when_good: When n_windows is small (3) and model disagreement is high (relative_spread_mean 2.49)

statistician.rationale: Added inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25 (stable performance) and topk_mean_per_horizon_k5 (robust horizon aggregation). Adjusted ridge_stacking_l250_topk3 shrinkage to 0.30 for better stability and trimmed_mean_r0.20 trim_ratio to 0.10 for reduced outlier sensitivity.

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.20
changes.reason: Reduced outlier impact while maintaining robustness

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small and stability is prioritized over aggressive trimming
